title: Rugby World Cup Player Ratings: Aaron Wainwright impresses to ensure Wales beat France
text:
Wales scrambled to their first semi-final since 2011 with a tense 20-19 victory over France in Oita.

Aaron Wainwright and Ross Moriarty scored the crucial tries for Warren Gatland's side, while France had Sebastien Vahaamahina sent off.

Here, Sportsmail rates each Wales and France player out of 10 for their performance in Oita.

WALES

Liam Williams - 7

Vital try-saving tackle in the French siege proved vital.

George North - 6

Butchered a key chance when Wales were desperate to score, and ran hard with little luck.

Owen Watkin - 6

A late replacement for Jonathan Davies, and lacked fluency in attack. Wales need Davies back.

Hadleigh Parkes - 6

Little spark in the final third, but made 31 hard-earned metres.

Josh Adams - 7.5

Defended well when he was seriously challenged, and smashed Alldritt once with a huge hit.

Dan Biggar's kicking kept Wales in contention throughout the closely-fought match in Oita

Dan Biggar - 7

Kicked his goals - which proved vital – but attacking-wise Wales were average. Missed touch a few times with kicks too.

Gareth Davies - 6 (T Williams, 55)

Tried for a couple of trademark intercepts without success. Williams came on to inject more pace.

Wyn Jones - 6 (Carré, 63)

Seen as the best scrummaging prop in the squad, but Welsh could not smash set-piece.

Ken Owens - 7 (Dee, 76)

Nineteen tackles as he threw himself in the way of the French.

Tomas Francis - 6 (Lewis, 63)

One penalty conceded, and took a knock in the second half before going off.

Ross Moriarty was sent to the sin bin but came back on to score the winning try for Wales

Jake Ball - 7 (Beard, 63)

Eleven carries, all for a metre each. Wales won all their lineouts when he was on, but did not dominate up front.

Alun Wyn Jones - 7.5

Felt like he and Owens were making every tackle when France battered into Wales in the second-half.

Aaron Wainwright - 8

Searing pace for his try, and does so much well for such a young boy. Will be a dominant figure for years.

Justin Tipuric - 7

Breakdown was a total mess – not helped by referee Peyper's interpretations – but a few classy touches.

Josh Navidi - 5 (Moriarty, 28 - 7)

Taken off early injured, but had been left for dust by Vakatawa when the centre set up Ollivon's try.

Aaron Wainwright delivered a stunning performance which included Wales' first try

FRANCE

Medard 8 (Rattez, 78 6); Penaud 7, Vakatawa 8, Fickou 7, Huget 7; Ntamack 8 (Lopez, 41 6), Dupont 8 (Serin, 73 6); Poirot 7 (Baille, 68 6), Guirado 7 (Chat, 50 6), Slimani (Setiano, 73 6), Le Roux 7.5 (Picamoles, 66 5), Vahaamahina 0, Lauret 7, Ollivon 7.5, Alldritt 7 (Gabrillagues, 55 6).
description: WILL KELLEHER AT THE OITA STADIUM: Wales reached their first-semi final since 2011 with a tense 20-19 victory over France, thanks to tries from Aaron Wainwright and Ross Moriarty.
